scenario1.heading: Pending Eligibility — Phone Interview Will Be Scheduled

summary.text: We identified an issue that could make you ineligible for benefits. We need to confirm your eligibility in a phone interview.

your-next-steps.text: Confirm we have your current phone number and mailing address. Go to the <0>UI Online homepage, select Profile from the main menu, then select Contact Information.
Check your mail for the Notification of Unemployment Insurance Benefits Eligibility Interview (DE 4800). It will explain the issue and help you prepare for the interview.

edd-next-steps.text: We will schedule a phone interview to determine your eligibility for benefits. This page will be updated with appointment details once your interview is scheduled.

summary.text: We identified a potential issue that could make you ineligible for benefits. You have a phone interview scheduled for:
Important: If you miss your phone interview, a decision will be made based on the available facts, which could result in your unemployment benefits being delayed or denied.

your-next-steps.text: Confirm we have your current phone number. Go to the <0>UI Online homepage, select Profile from the main menu, then select Contact Information.
Prepare for the interview. The Notification of Unemployment Insurance Benefits Eligibility Interview (DE 4800) includes the questions the interviewer is most likely to ask.
If you need to reschedule your interview, select Reschedule in the Appointments section on your <0>UI Online homepage. You must reschedule at least one day before the interview.

edd-next-steps.text: We will call you during your scheduled interview time. Your caller ID may show “St of CA EDD” or the UI Customer Service number 1-800-300-5616.

subBullets.text: If you do not receive a call from the EDD at your scheduled appointment time, we may have canceled your appointment because we confirmed your eligibility or resolved the issue before your interview.
If your appointment has been canceled, it will no longer display on your UI Online homepage.

summary.text: Your phone interview time has passed and your eligibility for benefits is under review.
Important: If you missed your phone interview, a decision will be made based on the available facts, which could result in your unemployment benefits being delayed or denied.

your-next-steps.text: Allow up to 10 days for the EDD to make a decision.

subBullets.text: If you are found eligible and no other issues are identified, we will pay you for all pending weeks.

If you are found not eligible, we will mail you a Notice of Determination (DE 1080CZ) with the reasons you were denied benefits and an Appeal Form (DE 1000M). If you disagree with the decision, you have the right to appeal.
If you are paid benefits and are later found not eligible, we will also mail you a Notice of Overpayment (DE 1444) that explains why you were overpaid.

summary.text: We identified an issue and may need to determine your eligibility or verify your information.

your-next-steps.text: Check your <0>UI Online homepage</0> and inbox for the latest updates.
Check your mail. We may send requests for additional information. Make sure to respond as requested to avoid delays in processing your claim.
For more information, visit <0>Claim Status: Pending Payment</0>.

edd-next-steps.text: We will contact you if we need more information to resolve the issue.
We will email you when you have weeks available to <0>certify for benefits</0>.

summary.text: You currently have no weeks available to certify for benefits.

your-next-steps.text: Check your <0>UI Online homepage</0> and inbox for the latest updates.
Check your mail. We may send requests for additional information. Make sure to respond as requested to avoid delays in processing your claim.
If it’s been more than 30 days since you last certified for benefits, you must <0>reopen your claim</0> before you can certify.

edd-next-steps.text: We will email you when you have weeks available to <0>certify for benefits</0>.

summary.text: You have weeks available to <0>certify for benefits</0>.

your-next-steps.text: Select Certify for Benefits in the Notification section on your <0>UI Online homepage.

edd-next-steps.text: When we process your certification, we will update the payment status. Go to the <0>UI Online homepage and select History from the main menu.

summary.text: Your benefit year has ended on your regular Unemployment Insurance claim. Although you have a claim balance remaining, you cannot be paid for additional weeks as your claim has expired.

your-next-steps.text: You currently have no weeks available to certify.
If you earned enough wages from an employer in the past 18 months and are still unemployed or working part time, you can apply for regular unemployment benefits.

summary.text: Federal extension benefits have ended. Although you have a federal extension with a balance remaining, federal law does not allow benefits to be paid for weeks of unemployment after the program ends.

your-next-steps.text: You currently have no weeks available to certify.
If you earned enough wages from an employer in the past 18 months and are still unemployed or working part time, you can apply for regular unemployment benefits.

summary.text: Pandemic Unemployment Assistance benefits have ended. Although you have PUA claim balance remaining, federal law does not allow benefits to be paid for weeks of unemployment after the program ends.

your-next-steps.text: You currently have no weeks available to certify.
If you earned enough wages from an employer in the past 18 months and are still unemployed or working part time, you can apply for regular unemployment benefits.

summary.text: Disaster Unemployment Assistance benefits has ended. Although you have a claim balance remaining, you cannot be paid for additional weeks as DUA benefits are payable only for weeks that fall within the Disaster Assistance Period.

your-next-steps.text: You currently have no weeks available to certify.
If you earned enough wages from an employer in the past 18 months and are still unemployed or working part time, you can apply for regular unemployment benefits.

continue-certifying.text: Continue to <0>certify for benefits</0> while we determine your eligibility.
